title: Histogram-based Parameter-efficient Tuning for Passive Sonar Classification
author: Amirmohammad Mohammadi (Texas A&M University), Davelle Carreiro (Massachusetts Institute of Technology Lincoln Laboratory), Alexandra Van Dine (Massachusetts Institute of Technology Lincoln Laboratory), Joshua Peeples (Texas A&M University)
relevance_why: The proposed histogram-based parameter-efficient tuning method could enhance audio classification tasks by improving accuracy and computational efficiency in processing acoustic data, which is relevant to Haohe Liu's research in audio processing.
background: Classifying passive sonar data to identify ships based on underwater acoustic signals, while efficiently tuning a pre-trained model using a novel method.
contribution: This paper introduces a histogram-based parameter-efficient tuning (HPT) method to solve the problem of adapting pre-trained models for underwater acoustic classification, achieving better accuracy and faster training than conventional approaches.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods, such as adapters, are limited by their inability to effectively capture distributional shifts in feature embeddings.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves on these methods by implementing histogram layers to learn and modulate feature distributions, thereby enhancing classification performance.

key_innovation: Integrating histogram layers into neural architectures to create a unique representation of feature distributions, allowing for more effective adaptation without retraining the entire model.
real_world_impact: The proposed method offers a scalable and efficient solution for sonar classification tasks, with potential applications in marine monitoring and security-related evaluations.
limitations: The authors acknowledge that optimal performance may depend on careful tuning of hyper-parameters such as bin numbers.

new_terms.parameter-efficient tuning: **Parameter-efficient tuning** is a method that freezes the weights of a pre-trained model while allowing only a small number of parameters to be updated for specific downstream tasks.
new_terms.histogram layer: **Histogram layer** is a type of neural network layer that captures and summarizes statistical distributions of input data to enhance feature representation.

open_sourcing: The code is publicly available at https://github.com/Advanced-Vision-and-Learning-Lab/HLAST_DeepShip_ParameterEfficient
